entries.meaning: (UK, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa) A table napkin, now especially a paper one. [From late 15th c.]
examples: She should unfold her serviette and place it on her lap. It is immaterial whether she places the bread on the right or left-hand side of the cover when taking it from the serviette.
A gentleman should do the same with his serviette and bread, placing the one across his knees, and the other at his right or left hand.
